tradeTitle: The Wheel + 'Super-Bull' Income Array on BMNR
summaryJustification: Aggressive adjustments executed. Position converted to a 'Covered Strangle' variant. Short Calls rolled up to $50 to capture upside, while 5x Put Credit Spreads (30/25) were deployed to generate $954 in auxiliary income. This massive credit collection aims to lower the effective share basis to ~$35.46 if all options expire OTM.
expectedReturnDisplay: Net Credit Collected: $1,263.88 / Effective Basis Target: $35.46

analysis.thesis: Bullish/Neutral Income. Leveraging high IV (112% implied) ahead of Dec 18 earnings. The 30/25 Put Spreads provide a robust buffer against a moderate drop, while the $50 Calls leave room for a post-earnings rally. The combined theta decay is now the primary profit driver.
analysis.strategyType: Covered Stock + Aux Put Credit Spreads
analysis.managementPlan:
CRITICAL DATE: Dec 18 (Earnings). Hold through volatility. 
1. Upside: If stock > $50, shares called away at massive profit. 
2. Downside: If stock < $30, manage Put Spreads (roll or take assignment). 
3. Sweet Spot: Stock between $30-$50 = Max Profit.

tradeProgression.notes: Opened 2 contracts at 1.40 for 7 DTE.
Assigned at $45.
Sold weekly covered call.
Premium realized.
Rescue mission initiated.

Sold 5x Put Credit Spreads @ $1.92 net ($3.48 cr - $1.56 dr). Total Aux Credit: $954.90. This buffer protects against downside drift.

tradeTitle: Delta-Skewed Short Iron Condor on META
summaryJustification: A Delta-Skewed Short Iron Condor was placed on META with 49 DTE to capitalize on the high absolute IV of 40.87%, despite a low IV Rank of 26.30%. The trade is skewed with a wider 10.00 put spread (645/635) to give the position a slight bullish bias, collecting a high net credit of 7.07.

analysis.thesis: META is trading post-earnings, which often leads to a volatility contraction. We are selling an Iron Condor to profit from the stock staying range-bound. The trade is intentionally skewed with the short put strike (645) close to the price (648.69) and a wider put wing (10.00) to maximize credit, reflecting a defined risk stance that the stock will not drop significantly lower than 635. The short call strike (650) is very close to the stock price to maximize credit, accepting higher risk for a very high return on capital.
analysis.managementPlan: Standard management plan: Target 50% profit ($353.50) to close the position. If the profit target is not met, manage at 21 DTE by rolling the entire unchallenged side (likely the call spread) closer to the money, or rolling the entire position out to a later expiration date for an additional credit.
